citation.article-title: Methanosarcina thermophila sp. nov., a thermophilic, acetotrophic, methane-producing bacterium.

p.s: Description of Methanosarcina thermophila sp. nov.
Methanosarcina thermophila (ther. mo'phi. la. Gr. adj. thermos hot; Gr. adj. philos loving; N. L. fem. adj. thermophila heat-loving)
Cells are gram positive and spherical and appear as irregular aggregates which are often more than 100 μm across and which appear refractile when viewed by phase-contrast microscopy.
Colonies in agar are 1 to 3 mm in diameter and yellow and have a rough granular consistency.
Growth occurs on acetate, methanol, or methylated amines and may occur slowly on H2-CO2.
The optimum growth temperature is near 50"C, and the optimum pH is between 6.0 and 7.0.
The only described strain requires para-aminabenzoic acid for growth.
The DNA base composition of this strain is 42 ± 1 mol% guanine plus cytosine.
